page.title: 17VILLAGE HALLS
page.content: TREMAYNE HALL; built as a poor house in 1921.Changed to a school a few months later, was burnt down and was rebuilt as a church hall as the education commitee gave it to the Parish Council.The hall is used for many different things; once a month Womens Institute, every Wednesday there is Bingo for old age pensioners. CONSERVATIVE HALL;built for the conservative party in 1954.Every Tuesday, Thursday and Friday doctors hold a surgery there, and at the moment a new surgery is being built for them. YOUTH CENTRE;people of Mylor wanted the centre to be used for the community as the youth of Mylor were not interested in having disco's in the summer.The centre is let out to youth organisations,such as Brownies. The centre was built in 1961 on the playing fields.
